benchmark_details.name: MSP60K
benchmark_details.overview: MSP60K is a new large-scale, cross-domain dataset for pedestrian attribute recognition consisting of 60,122 images and 57 attribute annotations across eight scenarios. It addresses challenges in existing datasets by incorporating synthetic degradation and diverse real-world conditions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for pedestrian attribute recognition models and facilitate the development of more effective PAR methods.

data.source: Dataset contains images collected using smart surveillance systems and mobile phones.
data.annotation: Images are labeled with 57 attributes across various scenarios.

methods: Evaluation of 17 pedestrian attribute recognition models
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predictions against ground truth labels provided in the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in recognizing pedestrian attributes under various conditions.
methodology.validation: Dataset split into random training/testing subsets and cross-domain scenarios to evaluate generalization.
